intro: Boronia thedae, commonly known as the Kangaroo Island boronia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and is found on the island of Kangaroo Island in South Australia. It has small, elliptical leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. Boronia thedae is of interest to botanists due to its unique adaptations and limited distribution.
